Create the Coordinate System** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] **2. Generate the Sketch** Now, let's generate the 2D sketch for the first part. This part consists of three faces (face\\_1, face\\_2, and face\\_3). *Face 1 Details* face\\_1 contains a single loop (loop\\_1) and a circle within it: * circle\\_1: + Center: [0.0187, 0.0188] + Radius: 0.0188 *Face 2 Details* face\\_2 contains a single loop (loop\\_1) and this loop consists of the following features in sequence: * line\\_1: + Start Point: [0.037, 0.0141] + End Point: [0.1133, 0.0141] * arc\\_1: + Start Point: [0.1133, 0.0141] + Mid Point: [0.1127, 0.0188] + End Point: [0.1133, 0.0234] * line\\_2: + Start Point: [0.1133, 0.0234] + End Point: [0.037, 0.0234] * arc\\_2: + Start Point: [0.037, 0.0234] + Mid Point: [0.0374, 0.0187] + End Point: [0.037, 0.0141] *Face 3 Details* face\\_3 contains a single loop (loop\\_1) and a circle within it: * circle\\_1: + Center: [0.1312, 0.0188] + Radius: 0.0188 **3. Scale the Sketch** Set the sketch scaling factor: 0.15 **4. Transform Sketch into 3D** Transform the scaled 2D sketch into the 3D sketch using the coordinate system created earlier. **5. Extrude the Sketch to Generate Part** Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal to generate a 3D model with the following properties: * Extrusion Depth towards Normal: 0.75 * Extrusion Depth opposite Normal: 0.0 * Height: 0.75 * Width: 0.15 * Length: 0.15 Upon completing these steps, you shall obtain the first intermediate part which contributes to the final shape: A long, rectangular, metallic object with a smooth surface, slightly tapered and narrower at one end.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the euler angles set to 0° in all three axes and a translation vector of [0, 0, 0]. This will serve as the origin for our first part. Create a new sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. Create the following lines: * Line 1: Start at [0, 0] and end at [0.75, 0] * Line 2: Start at [0.75, 0] and end at [0.75, 0.75] * Line 3: Start at [0.75, 0.75] and end at [0, 0.75] * Line 4: Start at [0, 0.75] and end at [0, 0] This will create a square loop on the X-Y plane. Exit the sketch mode. Now, extrude the sketch along the Z-axis with a depth of 0.381 units towards the normal. The resulting part will be a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Part 2: Cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side Create a new coordinate system with the euler angles set to 0° in all three axes and a translation vector of [0.1232, 0.1232, 0.381]. This will serve as the origin for our second part. Create a new sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. Create a circle at the center point of [0.2518, 0.2518] with a radius of 0.2518. Now, extrude the sketch along the Z-axis with a depth of 0.381 units opposite the normal. The resulting part will be a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side. To create a rectangular hole in the center of the cylinder's side, create a new sketch on the same face as the previous sketch. Create a rectangle with starting point at [0.2518, 0.2518] and ending point at [0.3518, 0.3518]. Exit the sketch mode. Now, extrude the sketch along the Z-axis with a depth of 0.381 units opposite the normal. This will create a rectangular hole in the center of the cylinder's side. The final shape will be a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. The length and width of both the prism and the cylinder will be 0.5036, and the height of both parts will be 0.381.</description>

prompt: <description>**Instructions for Part 1:** Construct a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a tapered top and a flat bottom. The top and bottom faces are parallel to each other, and the top face is perpendicular to the bottom face. The top and bottom faces are equidistant from the center of the prism. The height of the prism is approximately twice the width of the top face. The width of the top face is approximately three times the height of the prism. The resulting prism has the following dimensions: - Height: Approximately 0.045 units. - Width: Approximately 0.75 units. - Length: Approximately 0.75 units.</description>

The top and bottom faces are parallel to each other, and the top face is perpendicular to the bottom face. The top and bottom faces are equidistant from the center of the prism. The height of the prism is approximately twice the width of the top face. The width of the top face is approximately three times the height of the prism. </description>
